intro: Chamaesyce micromera, commonly known as the smallleaf sand mat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants adapted to arid environments. The plant has succulent, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water, and it produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert habitats. Its botanical features make it well-suited for xerophytic conditions and it is sometimes used in native plant landscaping.
